ygData.subject: Re: Fw: [EQMagicians] Just a thought..
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I believe their original intention ws to have as few numbers in the game as possible. This meant not seeing your actual HPs, AC, ATK, etc etc. However, in
ygData.messageBody:
> What reasons have they given for this, not giving us numerical values
> for our mana ?

I believe their original intention ws to have as few numbers in the
game as possible. This meant not seeing your actual HPs, AC, ATK, etc etc.
However, in beta these numbers were all present for testing purposes and
when Verant made some comments about going to a non-numerical based system
people whined and moaned so they left things as they were. Thus, we see
some numbers and not others making things totally inconsistent.
Personally, I think they should take all numbers out, but I don't think
things are going to change. Too many people on either side would bitch and
moan at any little change.


> Maybe it's just the mood I'm in, but do they strike you as pricks?
> I mean, honestly.. they give us, in the spell's info, how much mana it takes
> to cast it, but they're out-right refusing to give us numbers showing how
> much mana we have? They're just being pricks about it, or at least, that's
> how it seems to me. What basis would they have for not?

See above.

> Not to mention all of the other limitations, and the "you're in our
> world now" that I thought was just a cool slogan, but now seems to be more
> of another way to say, "this is our world, we're in control, we think for
> you, we decide how you play, where you go, what you see, and if you don't
> like it _leave_ because it's _MINE_" . That's B.S., we pay for this...

Hmm... would you rather that we have the situation in UO where everyone
is a master tank/mage, can wear plate in under a weak, and there is no
difference between anyone? Verant has done an amazing job with balance...
look how hard Blizzard had to work to balance 3 races. Verant had a TON
more to deal with, and has done a very commendable job. Is it perfect? No,
probably not. But they are fixing things as they go along. Just give
reasonable /feedbacks without incessant whining and they'll be more
inclined to listen. Just remember, they are _not_ going to 'upgrade' any
class/race in _any_ way unless it is a proven imbalance.

Valdus
